revision.comment: Rating for the [[WP:ALTF|Applied Lingusitics Task Force]]
revision.text:
{{WikiProject Linguistics|class=GA|applied=yes|applied-importance=mid}} {{ArticleHistory |action1=GAN |action1date=06:02, 11 March 2007 |action1result=not listed |action1oldid=112252703 |action2=GAN |action2date=07:21, 29 March 2007 |action2result=listed |action2oldid=118725124 |action3=GAR |action3link=Talk:BLEU/GA1 |action3date=00:20, 11 March 2009 (UTC) |action3result=kept |action3oldid=276403165 |currentstatus=GA |topic=Langlit }} {| class="plainlinks" style="padding: .25em; border: 1px solid grey; width: 99%; font-family:Verdana" | == [[WP:GA|Good Article]] [[WP:GAC|'''Nomination''']] == Good evening ([[GMT]] time); I have reviewed this article on {{CURRENTTIME}}, {{CURRENTDAYNAME}} [[{{CURRENTMONTHNAME}} {{CURRENTDAY}}]] [[{{CURRENTYEAR}}]] ([[UTC]]) in accordance with the [[WP:GA|Good Article]] (GA) [[WP:WIAGA|criteria]]. I have concluded that, in my opinion, the article has failed one or more categories and is therefore denied [[WP:GA|GA]] status. In order to provide constructive criticism, I have below listed one or more of my reasons for failing the article, beside the relevant criteria title; this should be taken as advice for improvement, rather than a list of reasons for failing. #Well-written: {{{wr|'''Failed'''}}} (Primary reason)
::"...''It does not seriously violate the standards in Wikipedia Manual of style, in particular .. [[WP:MOSDEF|Jargon]]''..." #Factually accurate: {{{fa|Pass}}} #Broad: {{{b|Pass}}} #Neutrally written: {{{nw|Pass}}} #Stable: {{{s|Pass}}} #Well-referenced: {{{wref|Pass}}} #Images: {{{i|Fail}}}
::"...''has [[Wikipedia:Images|images]] where possible''..." My condolences to the lead editors - your hard work has been informally recognised; just keep it up, and do not be disheartened! Feel free to renominate the article when the above improvements have been made, or alternatively seek a [[WP:GA/R|GA Review]] or discuss my decision at my [[user talk:anthony cfc|talk page]] if you believe I have been misguided. Sincerest regards,
[[User:Anthony_cfc|anthonycfc]] [[[User talk:Anthony_cfc|'''talk''']]] 06:02, 11 March 2007 (UTC) |} == oops missing info? == "This is illustrated in the following example from," from where? --[[User:Ling.Nut|Ling.Nut]] 16:45, 13 March 2007 (UTC) :Well spotted. This example is from Papineni 2002. I've noted this. - [[User:f-m-t|Francis Tyers]] [[User_talk:f-m-t|·]] 16:47, 13 March 2007 (UTC) == No pronoun antecedent == There are a number of 3rd person plural pronouns in the Performance section which have no obvious antecedent--e.g. "they highlight". Perhaps a sentence has been left out referring to a study by some researchers? Or is it one of the footnoted references, and if so, which one? [[User:Mcswell|Mcswell]] ([[User talk:Mcswell|talk]]) 23:13, 29 November 2007 (UTC) ==GA/R ended== In accordance with the [[WP:GA/R]] over this article, in a 3 to 1 vote, it has been listed as a [[WP:GA]]. Review archived in GA/R archive 15. [[User:Homestarmy|Homestarmy]] 15:55, 2 April 2007 (UTC) == algorithm candidate phrase? == is this correct - the candidate phrase is supposed to be ''the the the the the the the''? {|class=wikitable |+ Example of poor machine translation output with high precision |- | Candidate || the || the || the || the || the || the || the |- | Reference 1 || the || cat || is || on || the || mat |- | Reference 2 || there || is || a || cat || on || the || mat |- |} it doesn't seem to be from the text, but it's been that way since the algorithm section was first inserted. --[[User_talk:Ludwigs2|Ludwigs2]] 21:33, 29 March 2009 (UTC) :It is correct. See 'Example 2' in the BLEU paper. - [[User:f-m-t|Francis Tyers]] [[User_talk:f-m-t|·]] 11:28, 19 June 2009 (UTC) == Interactive Scoring Tool == I am the author of a freely available interactive BLEU scoring tool that is available at http://ibleu.googlecode.com. I believe that this information should be worth including in this BLEU wikipedia article. However, i wanted to run this by folks to make sure it was okay. There is also a peer-reviewed publication for the tool that can be cited [1]. [1] BLEU: Interactively Scoring and Debugging Statistical Machine Translation Systems. Proceedings of the Fifth IEEE International Conference on Semantic Computing (Demos). Nitin Madnani. The publication is going to be published in the proceedings of an upcoming conference (in September 2011) as can be seen at http://ieee-icsc.org. — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:DesiLinguist|DesiLinguist]] ([[User talk:DesiLinguist|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/DesiLinguist|contribs]]) 17:43, 23 July 2011 (UTC)
